description.p: Sometimes the spark of magic that fuels a sorcerer comes from a divine source that glimmers within the soul. Having such a blessed soul is a sign that your innate magic might come from a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being. Perhaps your ancestor was an angel, transformed into a mortal and sent to fight in a god’s name. Or your birth might align with an ancient prophecy, marking you as a servant of the gods or a chosen vessel of divine magic.

A Divine Soul, with a natural magnetism, is seen as a threat by some religious hierarchies. As an outsider who commands sacred power, a Divine Soul can undermine an existing order by claiming a direct tie to the divine.

In some cultures, only those who can claim the power of a Divine Soul may command religious power. In these lands, ecclesiastical positions are dominated by a few bloodlines and preserved over generations.

td.i: You gain immunity to disease and petrification.
You can reroll a wisdom ability check or saving throw once per long rest. You must declare you are using this ability after you roll and you cannot reroll a critical failure.
You can dispel the frightened or charmed condition on an ally once per long rest.

While raging you can expend an amount of health to recharge a spell usage from this subclass. To recharge Enemies Abound you must sacrifice 1/9th of your total health, to recharge Phantasmal Killer you must sacrifice 1/6th of your total health, and to recharge Geas you must sacrifice 1/3rd of your total health. This ability can only be used once per long rest.

When you hit an enemy while raging you have a chance to silence them. The enemy has to make a saving throw of DC 8 + your strength modifier + your proficiency bonus or be silenced until the end of their next turn. This ability can only target 1 enemy and can only be used once successfully per short rest.
You can ignore spell components for a spell provided by Path of the Devoid once per long rest.
You gain +1 to your strength modifier.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll 2d4 and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, the divine energy coursing through you can empower healing spells. Whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of hit points a spell restores, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once, provided you aren't incapacitated. You can use this feature only once per turn.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The wings last until you're incapacitated, you die, or you dismiss them as a bonus action.
The affinity you chose for your Divine Magic feature determines the appearance of the spectral wings: eagle wings for good or law, bat wings for evil or chaos, and dragonfly wings for neutrality.

description.p: At 18th level, you gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a bonus action when you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
